title: 2015 and the fear factor(ization)
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(n>1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be one of the factors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"20152015."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the least "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"-digit number factor of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"20152015."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#D61F06}{20152015} = (\color{#D61F06}{2015}\times\color{#20A900}{10000}) + \color{#D61F06}{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#D61F06}{20152015} = \color{#D61F06}{2015}(\color{#20A900}{10000} + 1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#D61F06}{20152015} = \color{#D61F06}{2015}\times \color{#3D99F6}{10001}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can conclude that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#3D99F6}{10001}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a factor of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#D61F06}{20152015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Knowing "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n = 5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (see proof below), we just have to proof that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#20A900}{10000}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not a factor of this number because it is only "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"-digit number that is less than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#3D99F6}{10001}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#20A900}{10000}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" has "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as a factor but "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#D61F06}{20152015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" cannot have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as a factor because "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#D61F06}{20152015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" doesn't end with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus, the number is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{\color{#3D99F6}{10001}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Proof that nnn must be equal to 555","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 \leq n \leq 8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" because prime factor of a number cannot go beyond the number, which has length of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"text","text":"cannot","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" because the last digit is "},{"type":"text","text":"not","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" even, this also deduce "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4, 6, 8."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"text","text":"cannot","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" because 3 "},{"type":"text","text":"cannot","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" divide "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#D61F06}{20152015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" by "},{"type":"text","text":"divisibility by 3 rule","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2 + 0 + 1 + 5 + 2 + 0 + 1 + 5 = 16 "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"which cannot be divided by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"text","text":"can","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" because the last digit is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"text","text":"cannot","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" because 3 is "},{"type":"text","text":"cannot","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" divide "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#D61F06}{20152015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" by "},{"type":"text","text":"divisibility by 7 rule","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 2015201-(2\times5) = 2015191 \rightarrow 201519-(2\times1) = 201517 \rightarrow20151-(2\times7) = 20137 \rightarrow 2013-(2\times7) = 1999 \rightarrow 199-(2\times9) = 181 \rightarrow 18-(2\times1) = 16"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" which cannot be divided by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #10: A Very Very Long Number
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/830a6063be.74cd726fbc.8RAsYm.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
A person writes the numbers 1 to 2015 together as
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"123456789101112131415…201320142015"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Calculate the total number of occurrences where ‘15’ appears in the whole number."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Done with four lines of Python:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"codeBlock","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1
2
3
4s = ""
for i in xrange(1,2016):
    s = s + str(i)
print s.count('15')


"}],"attrs":[{"text":"s = ""
for i in xrange(1,2016):
    s = s + str(i)
print s.count('15')
","language":null}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":""}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Numbers ending with 15 : 015,115,215,...,2015 (21 of them) but 1515 counted just once for now
Numbers begining with 15:150-159,1500-1599, (110 of them) now 1515 counted second time 
Numbers between:1150-1159(10 of them)
two numbers together 501|502,511|512...591|592 and 51|52(11 of them)
So,there  is 21+110+10+11=152 appears of '15'"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Here's the list of all the occurrences (not the solution) (spoiler alert):"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 to 100: 2 occurrences (123…141516…495051525354…)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"101 to 200: 11 occurrences (115…150151152…158159…)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"201 to 300: 1 occurrence (215)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"301 to 400: 1 occurrence (315)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"401 to 500: 1 occurrence (415)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"501 to 600: 11 occurrences 
(501502…511512…515…521522…531532…541542…551552…561562…"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"571572…581582…591592…)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"601 to 700: 1 occurrence (615)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"701 to 800: 1 occurrence (715)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"601 to 900: 1 occurrence (815)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"901 to 1000: 1 occurrence (915)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1001 to 1100: 1 occurrence (1015)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1101 to 1200: 11 occurrences
(1115…114911501151115211531154115511561157115811591160…)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1201 to 1300: 1 occurrence (1215)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1301 to 1400: 1 occurrence (1315)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1401 to 1500: 2 occurrences (1415…1500)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1501 to 1600: 100 occurrences (150015011502…15511552…15581559…15981599)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1601 to 1700: 1 occurrence: (1615)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1701 to 1800: 1 occurrence: (1715)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1801 to 1900: 1 occurrence: (1815)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1901 to 2000: 1 occurrence: (1915)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2001 to 2015: 1 occurrence: (2015)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #11: Find the Largest - Part II
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/830a6063be.d991f8d3e8.HtnWmi.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
Which is the largest?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{2015}{32}+\frac{2015}{32^2}+\frac{2015}{32^3}+...+\frac{2015}{32^{2014}}+\frac{2015}{32^{2015}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"B. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0.6-0.06+1.2-0.12+1.8-0.18+...+8.4-0.84+9.0-0.90"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"C. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"45+15+5+\frac{5}{3}+\frac{5}{3^2}+...+\frac{5}{3^{14}}+\frac{5}{3^{15}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"D. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+2+3+...+10+11"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

title: 2015 Countdown Problem 12: Sums of consecutive numbers

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            True that, will amend accordingly. Thanks! :)

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{To add two or more consecutive numbers at least one  has to be odd. Any}\\ \text{ power of 2 can not be built by summation that include an odd number.} \\~~\\
Any~\color{#3D99F6}{ odd~ number} > 1, \text{can always be obtained by adding the following }\\\text{two consecutive numbers.,}\\\dfrac{The~ odd ~number- 1} 2 +\dfrac{The~ odd ~number+ 1} 2.\\Any~\color{#D61F06}{ even~ number} \text{ may be obtain by adding only odd number of   }\\ \text{consecutive numbers, if the middle term is even. This middle term is also} \\ \text{the average.  So the sum would be } \\ \text{number of terms (which is odd) * (middle term)} \neq 2^{an~ integer}                "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2 (power) number's are only not consecutive :
 2"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"16"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"64"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"128"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"256"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"512"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1024"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2048"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4096 etc.  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I don,t know why 2 (power) number's are not consecutive. But this is true."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From 2 to 2015 range our answer is 10."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"answer = 10."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: Be Cos It's A New Year
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/EgupbB7LbN-33952.svg?width=350"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Given that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\cos{35°}=\alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", express "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sin{2015^\circ}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in terms of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A sine function has period of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"360^\circ "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \sin (2015^\circ) = \sin ( (2015 \bmod {360} )^\circ) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \Rightarrow = \sin (215) = \sin (180 + 35) = - \sin(35^\circ ) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"By applying "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \cos^2 A + \sin^2 A = 1 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and knowing that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \sin 35^\circ "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is positive, we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \sin 35^\circ = - \sqrt{1-\alpha^2} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"sin2015=sin(360 x 5 + 215)=sin215 i.e 3rd quadrant....as sin is negative in the 3rd quadrant therefore sin 215 = -sin 35....we know sin^2 35 +cos ^2 35=1....therefore
sin^2 35=1-cos^2 35=sin^2 35=1-a^2....therefore -sin 35=-(1-a^2)^1/2"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let:
alpha=cos(35)
sin(2015)=sin(215)
215 degrees is at the 3rd quadrant, therefore by pythagorean theorem:
sin(215)=-sqrt(((1)^2)-(alpha)^2)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #14: A Tale of Two Shops
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/830a6063be.fbd4bdd144.uq0b8y.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
Shop A and Shop B sell chairs with 3, 4 or 5 legs. Shops A and B have a total of 443 and 157 chairs for sale respectively. During a Year End Chair Sales Exhibition Shops A and B set up sales booths beside each other and the sellers from both shops realised that their chairs altogether have 2015 legs in total. They also realised that there are twice as many 3-legged chairs from both shops as 4 and 5-legged chairs from both shops for sale. They later sold all 3, 4 and 5-legged chairs at $15, $20 and $25 respectively, with both shops earning a total of $10,075 in sales revenue."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many 5-legged chairs both shops sold in total?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Photo credit: http://www.clker.com/clipart-shop.html","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the total number of 3, 4 and 5 chairs respectively from both shops."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+c=443+157=600"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3a+4b+5c=2015"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=2b+2c"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"15a+20b+25c=10075"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The 4th equation is the same as the 1st. Solving gives
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=400,\mbox{   }b=185,\mbox{   } c=15"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #15: Palindrome Integration
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/solvable/830a6063be.3be84a966c.3bGQYN.gif"}},{"type":"text","text":"
Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be a real number and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be a real-valued function on "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"the next palindrome larger than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not a palindrome); or"}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a palindrome)."}]}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For example, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(1001)=1001"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":","},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(1001.01)=f(1002)=1111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A=\int _{ 999 }^{ 2015 }{ f(x) \mbox{ } dx } "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"B=f(...(f(f(1603)-58)-58)...)-58"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{A}{B}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(1603)=1661. 1661- 58 =1603. So we get back to where we were. Iterating any number of times will get us back to 1603. So B=1603. Now for  999<x<=1001 we have f(x)= 1001.  1001<x<=1111 f(x)= 1111. Continuing in this fashion gives us f(x)=     2(1001) + 110 ( 1111+1221+ .... + 1991) + 11(2002) +13(2112) = 1586970 = A."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So A/B = 990"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #16: Some Brute Force & Luck Needed – Part I
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/830a6063be.c31e014403.4dH8px.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
A sequence is defined by the recurrence relation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_1=2015"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" equals the sum of the squares of each digit in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_{(n-1)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n≥2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many more square numbers than prime numbers are there between "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" inclusive?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"#GoodLuckHaveFun","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #17: A Graph Theory Problem
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/solvable/830a6063be.ce6b7081d4.lTTPyi.gif"}},{"type":"text","text":"
Suppose there are 2015 vertices. Let a complete graph on "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" vertices be denoted as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"K_n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Which statements are true?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"K_{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" has 2029105 edges."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"II. Suppose two "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"K_{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" graphs are connected together, by having exactly one edge connected between any vertex in each of the original "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"K_{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" graphs, to form a new graph "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"G_{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"G_{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is bipartite."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"III. Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"H_{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be a complete 2014-partite graph on "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2014^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" vertices, such that the number of vertices in each partition are equal. Then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"K_{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not a subgraph of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"H_{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}
